en: Doubtless there exists in this world precisely the right woman for any given man to marry and vice versa; but when you consider that a human being has the opportunity of being acquainted with only a few hundred people, and out of the few hundred that there are but a dozen or less whom he knows intimately, and out of the dozen, one or two friends at most, it will easily be seen, when we remember the number of millions who inhabit this world, that probably, since the earth was created, the right man has never yet met the right woman.
ko: 의심의 여지 없이 세상에는 어떤 남자이든 정확히 딱 알맞는 여자와 결혼하거나 그 반대의 상황이 존재하지. 그런데 인간이 수백 명의 사람만 알고 지내는 사이가 될 기회를 갖는다고 생각해 보면, 또 그 수백 명 중 열여 명 쯤 이하만 잘 알 수 있고, 그리고 나서 그 열여 명 중에 한두 명만 친구가 될 수 있다면, 그리고 또 만일 우리가 이 세상에 살고 있는 수백만 명의 사람들만 기억하고 있다면, 딱 맞는 남자는 지구가 생겨난 이래로 딱 맞는 여자를 단 한번도 만난 적이 없을 수도 있을 거라는 사실을 쉽게 눈치챌 수 있을 거야.
romanized: Doubtless there exists in this world precisely the right woman for any given man to marry and vice versa; but when you consider that a human being has the opportunity of being acquainted with only a few hundred people, and out of the few hundred that there are but a dozen or less whom he knows intimately, and out of the dozen, one or two friends at most, it will easily be seen, when we remember the number of millions who inhabit this world, that probably, since the earth was created, the right man has never yet met the right woman.

en: I panicked when I read that they expected big protests in Riyadh today, but then my wife reassured me, saying that she had just bought two bottles of olive oil, ensuring our living standard for months, even if oil prices were to explode.
ko: 오늘 리야드에서 대규모의 시위가 있다는 걸 읽고 충격 받았었어. 근데 그때 내 아내가 어떻게 날 안심시켰냐면, 자기가 이미 직전에 올리브유 두 병을 샀던 참이라고, 그래서 우리 생활은 몇 개월 동안은 전혀 문제가 없을 거라고 했거든, 아무리 기름값이 폭등한다고 해도 말이야.
romanized: I panicked when I read that they expected big protests in Riyadh today, but then my wife reassured me, saying that she had just bought two bottles of olive oil, ensuring our living standard for months, even if oil prices were to explode.

en: That man has hit bottom: his wife has left him, he's lost his job, and he's an alcoholic. The worst is that I know him--he used to be my boss five years ago.
ko: 저 사람은 인생의 바닥을 쳤어. 아내는 떠났지, 직업도 잃었지, 심지어 알코올 중독자야. 가장 끔찍한 건 뭐냐면 내가 그를 알고 있다는 사실이야--그 인간은 5 년 전 까지만 해도 내 상사였거든.
romanized: That man has hit bottom: his wife has left him, he's lost his job, and he's an alcoholic. The worst is that I know him--he used to be my boss five years ago.

en: Tom is looking for a way to make some money.
ko: 톰은 돈을 벌 방법을 찾고 있다.
romanized: Tom is looking for a way to make some money.

en: When I was a kid, I thought that if I died the world would just disappear. What a childish delusion! I just couldn't accept that the world could continue to exist without me.
ko: 내가 어렸을 때, 난 내가 죽으면 이 세상도 사라질 줄 알았었어. 이게 무슨 유치한 망상이지 뭐야! 난 단지 세상이 나 없이도 계속 존재할 거라는 사실을 인정할 수 없었을 뿐이었어.
romanized: When I was a kid, I thought that if I died the world would just disappear. What a childish delusion! I just couldn't accept that the world could continue to exist without me.

en: Leading a fulfilling life really comes down to a simple question: When you turn off the lights at night and your head is on the pillow, what do you hear? Your soul singing or Satan laughing?
ko: 만족스러운 삶의 영위는 간단한 질문에서부터 시작돼. 밤에 불을 끄고 베개에 머리를 베면, 무엇이 들리니? 네 영혼이 노래하는 소리, 아니면 악령이 웃는 소리?
romanized: Leading a fulfilling life really comes down to a simple question: When you turn off the lights at night and your head is on the pillow, what do you hear? Your soul singing or Satan laughing?

en: When I first took a C course, I couldn't understand a single thing explained in class. Thank God I got a friend of mine who's a programmer to explain to me how the whole caboodle works.
ko: 내가 C 수업을 처음 들었을 때, 난 강의 내용의 한 글자도 이해를 못 했었어. 진짜 다행스럽게도 나한텐 모든 것이 어떻게 작동하는지 알려줄 수 있는 프로그래머 친구를 뒀지 뭐야.
romanized: When I first took a C course, I couldn't understand a single thing explained in class. Thank God I got a friend of mine who's a programmer to explain to me how the whole caboodle works.

en: People that have experienced so-called 'lucid dreams' often describe them as being 'more real than reality'. They also describe reality after waking up from a 'lucid dream' to be like a 'whimsical dream'.
ko: 소위 말하는 '루시드 드림'을 경험해 본 사람들은 꿈을 두고 '현실보다 더 현실같다'고 묘사하곤 하지. 그리고 또 '루시드 드림'에서 깨어난 후의 현실을 두고 '기이한 꿈' 같다고 하지.
romanized: People that have experienced so-called 'lucid dreams' often describe them as being 'more real than reality'. They also describe reality after waking up from a 'lucid dream' to be like a 'whimsical dream'.

ko: 난 네가 충분히 잘 해 왔다고 생각해.

en: I promise to come back early.
romanized: I promise to come back early.

en: Today will be a great day!
romanized: Today will be a great day!

en: Adriano is the president of Algeria.
romanized: Adriano is the president of Algeria.

en: I think that this is what we need.
ko: 이게 우리에게 딱 필요한 것이라 생각한다.
romanized: I think that this is what we need.

en: He said that he was really upset.
romanized: He said that he was really upset.

en: The car was recalled because of a faulty air bag.
ko: 그 차는 에어백 결함으로 리콜 되었다.
romanized: The car was recalled because of a faulty air bag.

en: In Japan it's very hot in summer.
romanized: In Japan it's very hot in summer.

en: He just started going to school.
ko: 그는 이제 막 학교에 가기 시작했다.
romanized: He just started going to school.

en: Several people in our office can speak French.
ko: 우리 회사의 몇몇 사람들은 프랑스어를 할 줄 안다.
romanized: Several people in our office can speak French.

en: How did you know Tom was lying?
ko: 너 톰이 거짓말 하고 있는 거 어떻게 알았어?
romanized: How did you know Tom was lying?

en: I'd like to get off at Fifth Avenue.
romanized: I'd like to get off at Fifth Avenue.

en: There's nothing more precious than life.
romanized: There's nothing more precious than life.

en: Could you tell me about your trip to Australia?
ko: 당신의 호주 여행에 대해 제게 이야기 해줄래요?
romanized: Could you tell me about your trip to Australia?

en: She's married to a cousin of mine.
romanized: She's married to a cousin of mine.

en: Don't pretend to be someone you're not.
romanized: Don't pretend to be someone you're not.

en: Mary isn't really sick. She's only pretending to be.
ko: 메리는 진짜 아픈 게 아니다. 그녀는 단지 그런 척하는 것이다.
romanized: Mary isn't really sick. She's only pretending to be.

en: Tom said no one was in the classroom.
romanized: Tom said no one was in the classroom.

en: Did you ever have the symptoms which have just been described?
ko: 방금 설명한 증상을 겪은 적이 있나요?
romanized: Did you ever have the symptoms which have just been described?

en: He didn't know what to say.
romanized: He didn't know what to say.

en: It is especially cold this morning.
romanized: It is especially cold this morning.

en: Tom keeps dreaming about buying a new car.
ko: 톰은 새 차를 사는 것을 계속 꿈 꾸고 있다.
romanized: Tom keeps dreaming about buying a new car.

en: Tom doesn't look like a scoundrel.
romanized: Tom doesn't look like a scoundrel.

en: Tom is the star of the football team.
romanized: Tom is the star of the football team.

en: I don't know if I should go or not.
romanized: I don't know if I should go or not.

en: I just want to finish this today.
ko: 난 이걸 오늘 끝내고 싶을 뿐이다.
romanized: I just want to finish this today.

en: I need somebody to talk to.
romanized: I need somebody to talk to.

en: I think Tom and Mary didn't do what they said they did.
ko: 내 생각에 톰과 메리는 그들이했다는 걸 하지 않은 거 같다.
romanized: I think Tom and Mary didn't do what they said they did.

en: Were we supposed to ignore Tom?
romanized: Were we supposed to ignore Tom?
